before we understand what IBM Verify
Identity Protect does can you explain
the problem it solves yeah sure That's a
great place to start IBM Verify identity
protection was created to help our
customers address the big shift in the
threat landscape The big shift that I'm
referring to is the shift from fishing
and vulnerability exploits dominating as
the top initial access vector for
attacks to a surge in cyber threats
targeting compromised credentials
Combined with fishing identity based
attacks are now the number one attack
vector and 84% of organizations have
faced identity related breaches We
encapsulate this change in the threat
landscape with one simple slogan
Attackers don't hack in they log in
Identities are dynamic diverse and
unpredictable We look at identity as the
new perimeter and yet there's not many
technologies that protect and detect
threats for it Our mission is to solve
these problems with IBM's verify
identity protection
It sounds like on top of identity
becoming the new parimeter it's an
interesting time for our customers As we
see and help organizations move to the
cloud they need help identifying and
managing identities Yes the move to the
cloud is great but it also results in
fragments and identity security This is
where verify identity protection
otherwise known as VIP comes into play
VIP is an identity observability
platform that provides visibility into
the access path of how identities are
accessing enterprise assets VIP's
strengths lie in the following areas
Eliminating identity and access blind
spots remediating identity
infrastructure issues and unpredictable
and risky identity activity We'll spend
a few minutes talking about each of
these areas Going back to the first one
identity and access blind spots This
refers to detecting and enabling
remediation of identity related blind
spots such as shadow assets unauthorized
local accounts missing multiffactor
authentication and usage of unauthorized
SAS applications across any cloud or
platform Second identity infrastructure
issues This is all about providing
identity threat detection and response
capabilities with detailed contextual
analysis This identifies exposures
threats and attacks in near real time
across various tools that create an
identity infrastructure unpredictable
and risky identity activity This refers
to activity like detecting dangerous
misconfigurations caused by human error
hazardous deviations from security
controls and inadequate implementations
of identity tools such as MFA privilege
access and IM tools Verify identity
protection does this through holistic
identity protection with endtoend
visibility and contextual identity
observability by providing insights into
all identities whether human or machine
or non-human identities for applications
and services across the entire identity
fabric including cloud IDPs on premises
or hybrid directories MFA SSO SSO
solutions and more This identity
observability enables verify identity
protection to cover a wide range of
identity security posture management and
identity threat detection and response
use cases including identity hygiene
multiffactor authentication issues
privileged access management security
shadow access and insider threats All of
these use cases are easily customizable
and prioritized within the product to
focus on what matters the most for our
customers Can you elaborate a bit more
on how VIP does that yeah absolutely
It's what we say is our secret sauce
While many solutions out there are
identity centric and look at identity
logs that discover deviations in
identity systems other solutions are
network ccentric and can stitch paths to
tell you where there's anomalous traffic
But what we do is bring those two
approaches together We continuously
infuse the network flow traffic identity
activity with identity events Our goal
is to understand which identities are
doing what on the flow activity level
This is critical because once you have
identity context on the flow activity
all of a sudden you know all of the
things that identities do and access By
creating the access path VIP brings the
identity perimeter to life answering who
has access to what when and how Right So
VIP will tell you the context of where
the attack came from because you have
the flow data What about for AWS how can
this help our customers using AWS yeah
so the breadth of our use cases with VIP
unlocks many benefits for our customers
The first one is that our AWS customers
can improve their identity hygiene by
eliminating blind spots and
misconfigurations They can reduce the
identity attack surface and three
eliminate various security risks This
tool is perfect for AWS customers who
want visibility and insight into their
users and accounts by correlating
identity events to the net flow traffic
There are v variety of use cases that
extend to AWS customers similar to
things like identifying local AWS
accounts or detecting shadow access on
AWS or in other words detecting when an
asset may have been accessed by an
unmanaged user for example
Verify Identity Protection is easy and
flexible to deploy across hybrid cloud
environments For an AWS customer VIP
integration with AWS enables us to
analyze Amazon VPC flow logs Amazon S3
audit logs via AWS Cloud Trail and AWS
managed Active Directory With these
inputs enterprises gain expanded
visibility across their AWS environment
enabling them to monitor who is
accessing resources when and from where
to both their AWS assets and resources
like S3 storage buckets
What an AWS customer needs to know the
most about VIP is that it easily
collects cloud flow traffic from AWS and
combines their network flows with their
identity activity to provide full
realtime visibility VIP secures an
organization's consumption of AWS
services by analyzing the flow activity
going to and from AWS resources to
detect unauthorized access and prevent
data excfiltration
So if you're looking for a solution that
